intro: Triumfetta micropetala, commonly known as the small-petalled triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its small, yellow or white flowers are followed by capsule fruits that release tiny seeds, aiding in its propagation.
